components.description:
A horse, a hoofed mammal used for riding and racing. Depicted as a brown horse in full profile galloping to the left, with a dark, flowing mane and tail.

May be used to represent various types of horses and their metaphorical senses (e.g., mustang, stallion).

May also be used as a compliment to an attractive person.

One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac.a

Not to be confused with üê¥ Horse Face, üé† Carousel Horse, and üèá Horse Racing, which features a jockey on its back.

Apple’s horse is wearing a green saddle blanket, Facebook’s a blue blanket with saddle. SoftBank’s design previously featured a racing horse with a jockey.

title: Horse

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A galloping horse with saddle. The same as the Horse Racing Emoji, but without a jockey riding it.¬†Created in a photorealistic style in Appl http://emojipedia.org/horse/
emoji_net_data.name: horse

bn:00008355n: A horse that competes in races.

bn:00065828n: Competition where the goal is to complete the course as fast as possible
The sport of competing in races.
The sport of engaging in contests of speed
In sport, racing is a competition of speed, against an objective criterion, usually a clock or to a specific point.

bn:00031345n: The horse is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus.
Subspecies of Equus ferus, or the wild horse
Solid-hoofed herbivorous quadruped domesticated since prehistoric times
Horses are large ungulates, which have had a long relationship with human society.
A large animal with four legs of the Equus caballus species which people ride on or use for carrying things or pulling vehicles.
